newsitem.title: LATVIA: BA optimistic as starts Riga flight.
newsitem.headline: BA optimistic as starts Riga flight.

text.p: Leading airline British Airways was optimistic on Tuesday after launching its first flights between Riga and London.
The first British Airways jet to fly to Latvia landed on Sunday evening. The service runs four times a week and is the first BA service to any of the Baltic states.
"The first flight was a success and all is going acording to plan," Harvey Lines, British Airways manager for the Baltics, told Reuters.
"Bookings for flights at this stage, which is very early on in terms of the rollout, are positive.
"We are optimistic that this will be a successful service," he added.
British Airways is competing with local airlines Air Baltic, part-owned by Scandinavian Airlines, and Riair, which cooperates with Russia's Transaero for the direct Riga to London traffic.
Lufthansa also offers connections to London via Frankfurt and SAS flies to the U.K. capital via Stockholm and Copenhagen.
